lead_paragraph: The United States Government ended its fiscal year on June 30 with a Treasury position that defies comparison with all previous records in the nation's history. Revenues for the year were 21 billion dollars, which is four times the immediate pre-war average. Expenditures were 76 billion, ten times the pre-war average and four times the peak year of spending in the First World War.
